SENT.plain: A 62-year-old woman who underwent heart transplantation 6 years later presented a regular atrial tachycardia
Electrophysiologic evaluation showed an atrial arrhythmia in the recipient atrium with 2:1 conduction to the donor atrium, with a confusing electroanatomical map
With the suspect of alternant conduction through two different breakthroughs, the map was split in two concordant maps, corresponding to two connections that were successfully ablated
Later on, a third connection was detected and therefore ablated
